sen.e: Minyu-sha was an opinion group and publishing house established by Soho TOKUTOMI.

sen.j: 雑誌『国民之友』を創刊し山路愛山・竹越与三郎・徳冨蘆花・国木田独歩らが入社した。
sen.e: The group founded the magazine "Kokumin no Tomo (Friend of the people)", and Aizan YAMAJI, Yosaburo TAKEKOSHI, Rokka TOKUTOMI and Doppo KUNIKIDA joined the magazine.

sen.j: 民友社は「平民主義」（平民的欧化主義）を標榜して政府による「欧化主義」を「貴族的欧化主義」と批判した。
sen.e: Minyu－sha promoted "commoner-ism" (commoner's Europeanism), criticized the government's Europeanism as "aristocratic Europeanism", and led the movement that divided the opinion world into two by confronting the nationalism (national conservatism) promoted by Seikyo-sha.
Minyu-sha promoted "democratism" (commoner's Europeanism) and criticized 'Europeanism' by the government as "aristocratic Europeanism".

sen.j: 政教社の掲げる国粋主義（国粋保存主義）とも対峙し当時の言論界を二分する勢力を形成した。
sen.e: Minyu-sha also opposed the nationalism (national conservatism) promoted by Seikyo-sha and formed a group that halved the reputation in the opinion of the time.

sen.e: The Minyu-sha also opposed the ultranationalism (the principle of preserving the national essence) promoted by the Seikyo-sha; these two groups evenly split contemporary public opinion.

sen.j: 自由民権運動の穏健派（改進党など）に近い立場をとり、『国民之友』では進歩的な言論や欧米での社会問題が紹介された。
sen.e: Minyu-sha took the position close to moderates (Kaishin Party and others) of The Freedom of People's Rights Movement, and progressive comments and European and American social problems were introduced in "Kokumin no Tomo".

sen.j: また、近代の新しい文学作品の発表舞台としても作家たちから重視され、森鴎外の「舞姫」などが掲載された。
